intro: Pupalia lappacea var. lappacea, commonly known as the common pupalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Mediterranean. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a hairy texture, and it prefers well-drained soil in full sun. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
